title: bettor-help
author: bettor-help
content: Hello, I offer help to pass verification process on 22bet and other bookies. telegram: G44433

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.created_time: December 16, 2022, 10:39:01 AMLast edit: December 16, 2022, 10:56:00 AM by Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: bettor-help on December 16, 2022, 10:32:53 AMHello, I offer help to pass verification process on 22bet and other bookies. telegram: G44433Firstly, you may also provide more info about charges taken, which country kyc you doing, etc.Secondly, what is 22bet? Never heard about it before, neither can I find any info about it in the forum's gambling board.Thirdly, nobody should register on any scam site provided by the OP without knowing information about the casino (popularity, reviews, etc).Upon doing some research, just found a thread from 2021 which says: 22bet is a fraud

Never heard about it before, neither can I find any info about it in the forum's gambling board.Thirdly, nobody should register on any scam site provided by the OP without knowing information about the casino (popularity, reviews, etc).Upon doing some research, just found a thread from 2021 which says: 22bet is a fraudThe price of the service you are to know is a scam. This type of service will take scammers and also this will be a false document or stolen document. So we should avoid this type of user and/or this type of service to avoid scams. Hope you got my point of view of mine.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: If betting profile and KYC documents are all registered in your names, what guarantees the user that such an account is safe in the long run from being repossessed ? And btw in the event of a new KYC request and you aren't available, does this mean user loses any funds on this account...

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: Quote from: bettor-help on December 16, 2022, 10:32:53 AMHello, I offer help to pass verification process on 22bet and other bookies. telegram: G44433First of all this is illegal. If any bookies find that you are providing fake KYC documents, then they gonna block your account simply and won’t reply you for the rest of your life. If this happens, then forget about the winnings, they won’t refund your deposit money also. What’s the issue with giving the KYC details? If your hard earned money is at stake? Be honest with bookies, and they will be honest with you. Moreover in the OP you have mentioned about 22bet, to be honest I haven’t heard about them. Upon researching, I found that there are many scam accusations against them. So it doesn’t matter now, you might not get your money back, if you submit the real KYC documents. From next time onwards choose a legit and trustworthy casino.
